Once again, we regret that cannot yet conclude this issue and recognise this prolongs uncertainty. However, we wanted to honour our commitment to update you by 25 November and reassure you that are working hard to resolve matters. https://t.co/iGz33Zytvx

We heard about the impact exams and exam outcomes have had on some of our doctors in training, valued colleagues alongside whom we work. We want to be very clear that we have heard and take your concerns seriously. https://t.co/iGz33Zytvx

We have also provided answers to the questions raised at our various engagement events, for questions where answers are available. The devastation, uncertainty and personal impact felt by so many was clearly articulated. https://t.co/iGz33Zytvx

An update regarding ongoing analysis, next steps, and future milestones.
https://t.co/Oike2xtzAZ

4/4
@NHSEngland are also getting ready to release further guidance shortly on which both the Faculty and Society have been consulted.

3/4
Our statement aims to ensure that where capacity transfers are performed, it is done in the safest manner possible and after all other alternatives have been considered at all levels.

Planned surgery capacity transfers are not a sustainable alternative to an appropriate increase in adequately funded/staffed ICU (L2&3) and enhanced care (L1) beds
However, over the past two years, transfers have been an essential part of our ability to manage COVID patients.
2/4

In collaboration with @ICS_upates we have published our joint position statement on capacity transfers of critically ill patients. 
👉https://t.co/5AgamyXv3T
1/4 https://t.co/JoYnJpG5C8

We are looking at the difference in pass rates of the 2 components of the FFICM OSCE/SOE exam. We have been considering the variations alongside representations and questions we received over the weekend and are meeting today and over the next few days to look into this further.

Joint statement from the Faculty and @RCoANews  following the release of the FFICM OSCE/SOE examination results yesterday. Once again, our sincere apologies to all concerned for the delay and confusion caused.

https://t.co/pfbh2oqlFD

All #FFICM exam results have now been sent. If you have not received yours or are having an issue with your email address (possibly a https://t.co/R7abq3UdMQ) please contact exams@rcoa.ac.uk. Our sincere apologies for the delay and any distress it has caused. @RCoANews

@TurtonsOther @Neil_brain1 @RCoANews @AlisonPittard A fair comment Pete and not our intention at all. Our admins were working in good faith with information they had at the time. But there’s no excuse for the confusion and we and @RCoANews will investigate the miscommunication here to ensure it doesn’t happen again.
@pjk989 Apologies for the hold up Paul. The @RCoANews exams team are all still working on getting results sent out as we speak.
@TurtonsOther @Neil_brain1 @RCoANews @AlisonPittard Apologies for the hold up Pete. The @RCoANews exams team are all still working on getting results sent out as we speak.

Apologies for some confusion over #FFICM exam results. The Exams Team's plan was originally to send results by post. However, we have been informed that in order to make sure candidates can receive results as soon as possible, results are being sent out via  email today.

Life After Critical Illness: A guide for developing and delivering aftercare services for critically ill patients
🟠74% of hospitals have outpatient post ICU services
🟠71% of sites are funded at risk
Learn more from the full document here👉https://t.co/zpaInSzva7 https://t.co/slDpeKBZzM

LACI builds on the clinical practice experience, the evidence base and the existing national guidance available in the UK to give clear and detailed guidance  on how to develop, deliver and fund these services.

@martynbjones @ajamsharman @quartered_onion Thanks Martyn. Since FICM’s inception in 2010, our regulations have not permitted doctors in training to vote in consultant Board elections. The FICM Board are aware and will consider the issue in our next regulations review. Feedback is certainly welcome to inform discussions.

"Enhanced Perioperative Care will provide a service for patients with needs beyond normal postoperative wards, but who are not expected to require Level 2 or 3 care. We must also be clear that Enhanced Care is not a ‘step down’ ward from ICU or ‘critical care on the cheap’.”

Dean @AlisonPittard said: "I am delighted to see the release of this guidance and the development of #EnhancedCare in the UK. Experience during the #COVID19 pandemic highlights the need for our services to be safe, flexible and resilient and to welcome opportunities to innovate."

We are delighted to announce the publication today of 'Guidance on Establishing and Delivering Enhanced Perioperative Care Services', a joint publication with @CPOC_News and with collaboration from multiple national bodies and senior leaders.

We've now been able to discuss key ramifications with the central HEE office that opted to reset ICM offers & achieved a positive outcome.  A more reassuring picture than before.  More info will come when offers go out again on Weds. Please read here: 
https://t.co/njU8zz2Bsp

Been good to speak by IM and email with some of those affected over the last few hours.  Will keep sharing info as it comes in from RCPLondon and HEE from here and from @mcarpenter1967 @Sarah68C @DannytheBaker @AlisonPittard

@rachelcjones HEE confirmed they would reset all ICM offers and re-offer by Weds.  They expected impact on ICM to be minimal.  As issue is not with our recruitment process, we are chasing up for more info as it becomes available.  Apologies for the uncertainty the error from RCP has caused

Cannot underestimate the personal impact this may have.  If you need support, email us at contact@ficm.ac.uk and we will stay in touch with you as info comes in.  As this is an RCP issue, they are happy to be contacted directly at st3recruitment@rcplondon.ac.uk for info 2/2

We have been made aware by HEE of an @RCPLondon recruitment issue that impacts ICM offers.  This is deeply disappointing news when ICM recruitment was without issue.  We have contacted all RAs, TPDs and FTs, and HEE will contact those directly affected.  1/2
